snippet: Paintings by Abdul Wasi Hamdard can be found in every corner of the world, but as foreigners leave Kabul, the market for his work — and his drive to create it — has dried up.
abstract: Afghan artist Abdul Wasi Hamdard, who had been relatively successful in years following Taliban rule, has found that as foreigners begin leaving country the market for his work has dried up, along with his drive to create it.
lead_paragraph: Paintings by Abdul Wasi Hamdard can be found in every corner of the world, but as foreigners leave Kabul, the market for his work — and his drive to create it — has dried up.

headline.seo: Abdul Wasi Hamdard, Afghan Artist Admired Everywhere but Home
headline.main: Afghan Artist, Admired Around the World, Yearns for Acceptance at Home
headline.print_headline: Afghan Artist, Admired Around the World, Yearns for Acceptance at Home
